data.title: Culture
data.text: The first time entering this wine bar, I was thrown backwards. I thought I was going to a wine bar but, discovered it was also an Art Gallery. The owner is an exceptional artist who displays art from various local and regional artist. I purchased a piece that I can leave to my children with pride and can kick myself for not getting the second one at that time. The wine was also first class from Texas vineyards, Going back very soon.

data.title: Nice surprise
data.text: We were pleasantly surprised with The Black Swan. Serving beer and wine, they had a good selection of both. We went on a Saturday night and the place was full.  Service was excellent.  They had live music also.  We had a great time there.  I would recommend for anyone looking to enjoy a nice night out for a date or with friends.  We would definitely visit again.

data.title: Felt like an intimate, private party!
data.text: My sister and I visited San Angelo last fall and were taken to the Black Swan by my aunt and uncle--locals who frequent the place often.  The setting is small and cozy; the proprietor is very friendly and helpful (we sampled several different cheeses and wines), and there is interesting art for sale along the walls.  (It is my understanding that the art changes often, so there is always something new to look at.)  The ambience was relaxed and casual.  I felt that we got great service, and the variety of good wines and cheeses was a pleasant surprise.  I would definitely recommend this place to visitors in the area.

data.title: Poor Customer service and selection
data.text: Went in for a wine tasting that was advertised.  When we asked for the tasting they only offered one wine to taste and said we could have 6 tastings of the same wine.  A tasting is to taste many different wines.  When we asked why there was not more of a selection we were told that that is just the way it is if we didn't like it we could go somewhere else.

data.title: Nice and Pricey
data.text: It's probably the most relaxing place downtown to enjoy a nice wine and a cheese plate.  A little over priced to be honest, but you only live once, so enjoy.

data.title: very very nice
data.text: I wish they served more than just wine, because I'm not a wine drinker.  But it's a very lovely, upscale and comfortable place with a great, welcoming vibe.  We were there on Thursday, "open mike" night, so got to listen to several good local musicians.  A glass of merlot was $7-10.  Great place to spend a couple of hours.

data.title: Nice wine bar with a great selection
data.text: I really like their wine "flights." A reasonably priced selection of three related wines. Allows people to sample something new without being stuck with something they don't really like. The free olives and crackers are a nice touch and the cheese plate was tasty.
